episode_title: 409 - The One Where They’re Gonna PARTY!

content.description: Outside Central Perk, Monica and Phoebe are showing everyone the van they bought for the catering business. It’s an old Dodge van, that has a cartoon woman riding on a dragon painted on the side of it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Come on, no peeking! (They are leading the gang out with there hands over their eyes.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Our eyes are closed and we’re about to cross the street. Very good.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okayyyyy, open up!
(They open their eyes and are stunned at the van.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What did you want to show us? Because all I can see is this bitchin’ van!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, it’s for our catering business!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I think I know that girl.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, umm, we’re not gonna really keep it this way though.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, we’re gonna paint over the sword, and replace it with a baguette.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: And also, we don’t know what to do with this. (She turns on a switch and the girl’s nipples light up.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh yeah, I definitely know her.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, the gang is all there.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Remember that guy from cooking school I told you about that put cilantro with everything?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh sure, Cilantro Larry.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, I’m gonna fill in for him as food critic for the Chelsea Reporter.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow, Monica! What an amazing opportunity to influence… dozens of people.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: How could you say yes, what about our catering business?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh no-no-no, it’s only one night a week, and plus I get to take all of you out for a lot of free dinners.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Yay!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, in that case—(hops up and down in joy)—Yay! (Monica looks confused) That was me hopping on board.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, you guys! Hey, Ross, quick question for ya. Are you ready to party?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t know, I could maybe go out for a couple of beers, but there’s this thing about bumblebees on The Discovery Channel that I was planning to watch.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No-no, I don’t think you heard me. Are you ready to party ?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Nooo!! Gandolf?! Gandolf is coming to town?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Kathy’s with her parents, I have nothing to do, so tomorrow we are partying with Gandolf dude!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Dude, we are sooo gonna party!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow! Okay, dude alert! And who is this guy?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Mike “Gandolf” Ganderson, only like the funest guy in the world.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m gonna call and get off work tomorrow!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m gonna call after you!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: This is gonna be soo cool, dude, we never party anymore!

content.speaker: Chandler and Ross
content.text: Woooo!!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, were you guys smoking something in the back of our van?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Really. And what do you mean you never have fun anymore? You have fun with me, remember that time we saw those strippers and you paid me 50 bucks to eat that book?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Joey, you are gonna love this guy. Gandolf is like the party wizard!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, why do you call him Gandolf?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Gandolf the wizard. (Joey is still confused) Hello! Didn’t you read Lord of the Rings in high school?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, I had sex in high school.

content.description: Rachel’s office, Rachel and Sophie are sitting at their desks working as Joanna walks in.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, uh, Joanna I was wondering if I could ask you something. There’s an opening for an assistant buyer in Junior Miss…

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: Okay, but that would actually be a big step down for me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, actually, I meant for me. The hiring committee is meeting people all day and…

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: Oh. Well, I wish I could say no, but you can’t stay my assistant forever. Neither can you Sophie, but for different reasons.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: God, I am so glad you don’t have a problem with this, because if you did, I wouldn’t even consider applying.

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: Really? Well, in that case…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And that’s I’m so glad… there’s no problem.

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: That’s fine, actually I’m on the hiring committee, so there’ll be at least one friendly face.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh! That’s great!

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: You know, Junior Miss is where I started. Oh, I had to sleep with the ugliest guy to get that job.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really?!

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: No-ho-ho! (pause) Yeah. (pause) I mean, no-no-no-no-no, don’t you worry, I’m sure with your qualifications you won’t need to sleep with some guy to get that job. Although, I might need some convincing.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I, umm…

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: Kidding! God, I feel wild today!

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Chandler is getting ready to party.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh man! I am so excited—I may vomit!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Will you calm down, he’s just a human guy.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look you don’t understand, Gandolf is amazing. Y’know you’re never know what’s gonna end up happening, you go out for a couple of beers and end up on a fishing boat to Nova Scotia!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Really?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh yeah, it’s beautiful country up there.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey! Okay! I got my passport, fresh socks, and a snake bite kit!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s not gonna be exactly like last time.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, I’ll see you guys.

content.speaker: Chandler and Ross
content.text: Whoa-whoa-whoa!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Whoa-wh-wh-whoa-whoa-whoa-whoa!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I have an audition, but I’ll definitely hook up with you later. Where are you gonna be around noon?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Somewhere maybe along the equator?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay. (leaves as the phone rings)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hello. (listens) (to Ross) It’s Gandolf!!! (on phone) So, are you in town? (listens) (disappointed) Oh, well, well maybe next time then. (Hangs up)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What happened?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: He’s not gonna make it, he’s stuck in Chicago.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ohh, man! Chicago, is sooo lucky!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Stupid, useless Canadian money!

content.description: [Scene: Bloomingdale’s, Rachel is meeting with Mr. Posner, Mrs. Lynch, and Joanna the hiring committee.]

content.speaker: Mr. Posner
content.text: You have a very impressive resume, Ms. Green. I especially like what I see here about implementing a new filing system.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: Filing system? Oh-oh! You mean those-those little colored labels you put on all the folders? (to the committee) It certainly did brighten up the inside of the filing cabinets.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, they uh, they-they do more than that.

content.speaker: Mrs. Lynch
content.text: I notice that you’ve been trusted with a lot of rather important responsibilities.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes, Joanna really has been an incredible mentor to me.

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: Oh. And Rachel has been really incredible in getting my morning bagel for me. It’s amazing how she gets it right almost every time!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I-I-I of course, I have more responsibilities than that.

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: Oh yes, well there’s the coffee too. (to the committee) Rachel can carry two things at once!

content.speaker: Mr. Posner
content.text: Yes, that’s very good. Now a uh, big part of this job is cultivating personal relationships, especially with designers.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes, I realize that…

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: And Rachel shouldn’t have any problem with that. The only problem might be getting a little too friendly, if you know what I mean.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I love working with designers!

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: With them, under them, what’s the difference? Eh, Rach?

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Phoebe is there as Monica enters carrying a huge stack of newspapers.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey! My first review is out!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh! Oh, the Chelsea Reporter, ohh, this used to keep me so warm.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, look at my on the back page.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, okay! (reading) “Would I go back to Allesandro’s? Sure, but I’d have to order two meals, one for me and one for the guy pointing the gun to my head.” (to Monica) Wow! You really laid into this place.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, they don’t pay me a penny a word to make friends.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, I gotta go. I found a guy that who could fix up the van for catering.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh! Do you need me to go with you?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No-no, it’s okay. But are we sure we don’t want the waterbed?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Haven’t we made this decision?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, all right. (starts to leave)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Bye!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Bye!
(The intercom buzzes.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Who is it?

content.speaker: Allesandro
content.text: It’s Allesandro, from Allesandro’s.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God.

content.speaker: Allesandro
content.text: I want to talk to you about your review.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God, oh my God. (on intercom) Call me on the phone!

content.speaker: Allesandro
content.text: Why? So you could hang up on me?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Look, I-I’m never gonna let you up so you may as well just go away.

content.speaker: Allesandro
content.text: Just give me a chance too…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey, do you need to get in? Here you go.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No! Phoebe!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey, Monica!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, continued from earlier.

content.speaker: Allesandro
content.text: I want a retraction! Our food is not inedible swill!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I couldn’t eat it! I had five friends who couldn’t eat it, and one of them eats books.

content.speaker: Allesandro
content.text: Well our service is not grossly incompetent.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: The waiter carried the breadsticks in his pants!

content.speaker: Allesandro
content.text: Well, you said that we except the Discover Card , which we do not!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, that I’ll retract. But I stand by my review, I know food and that wasn’t it. You’re marinara sauce tasted like tomato juice! You should serve it with vodka and a piece of celery.

content.speaker: Allesandro
content.text: Hey! I’m proud of that sauce, it’s delicious.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God! You own an Italian restaurant and you think that tastes good?! Where are you even from?

content.speaker: Allesandro
content.text: Lebanon.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hand me those tomatoes, I’m gonna show you what it should taste like! Come on, hand me them.

content.speaker: Allesandro
content.text: How long is this gonna take? ‘Cause I got another critic to go yell at.

content.description: Rachel’s office, Rachel is confronting Joanna about her interview.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Umm, Joanna? I wanna talk about that interview.

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: I thought it went very well.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! It didn’t! That’s what I want to talk to you about. (starts to break up) Now, just to brief you… (starts to cry) I may cry, but they are not tears of sadness or of anger, but just of me having this discussion with you.

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: Rachel, please, don’t make a scene.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: There’s nobody here!

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: Sophie, get in here! (Sophie enters) You see! Now you’re making Sophie uncomfortable!

content.speaker: Sophie
content.text: She’s not making me uncomfortable.

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: Congratulations! You now just crossed the line into completely useless. Get out. (Sophie starts to cry and leaves)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Do you want me to quit?

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: What?! What would make you think that?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well of those things that you said in the interview, I mean if you believe any of them, I must not be a very good assistant. Y’know what? I am just gonna pack up my desk, (She goes over to get all of her belongings from the desk, which amount to a muffin and a pen) and I will be gone by the end of the day! (Realizes she has nothing.) Well, I guess there’s no use to me sticking around ‘til the end of the day! (Starts to leave.)

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: Wait-wait-wait-wait! You can put your sad little muffin back in it’s drawer. If you must know the truth, I didn’t want to lose a perfectly good assistant.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: That’s why I said all those things about your flirting and your drinking…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: My drinking?

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: Oh, I must’ve said that after you left.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Said what? Exactly.

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: That you enjoyed the occasional drink…ing binge.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God!! Ohh, that is it! I’m leaving! You are just a horrible person!

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: Wait-wait-wait-wait-wait-wait-wait-wait!! If you’re gonna get all sensitive about it! I don’t want to lose you. What if I, create a position for you? I’ll make you an assistant buyer in this department.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Say more things like that.

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: You can have your own office, and a raise! Effective tomorrow.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’d need an expense account.

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: Done!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And an assistant.

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: Sophie, get in here! (Sophie peeks in around the corner)

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Ross and Chandler are watching TV as Joey enters.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! What are you guys doing here? I thought you’d be out partying with Gandel-worf.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s Gandolf, and he’s not coming.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So you’ve been sittin’ around here all mornin’?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No! I balanced my checkbook.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, and I-I gave first names to all of the foosball players.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I can’t believe he didn’t come!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So what if he didn’t come! We can still go out and party ourselves!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh-no, y’know with Gandolf we’d be out all night!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah! We’d meet, we’d meet total strangers, and hang out with them!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, we could do that!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: There’s other stuff too.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: We’ll do it all, and better! Look, after tonight, Gandolf will want to party with us, dude! Come on!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s not like we don’t know how to party!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah! All right? Let’s go!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And may-maybe we could end up on a boat again?

content.speaker: Joey and Ross
content.text: Yeah!!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey-hey-hey, when uh, when were we on a boat?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Remember that really cold morning, you woke up and those dogs were licking your face?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, those were seals, man.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Rachel is entering, excited.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey Mon, little question for ya! How do you think this suit will look on an assistant buyer?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, the owner of Allesandro’s came over to yell at me, but instead I made him some sauce, and he offered me the job as head chef!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God!! You just ruined the thing I was practicing the whole way home, but I’m soo happy!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Can you believe it? I finally get to run my own kitchen!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, you’ve waited soo long.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, Pheebs, quick question for ya.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: How do you think this suit would look on an assistant buyer at Bloomingdale’s ?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I don’t know, it would totally depend on her coloring and… (realizes) You got the job!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes!!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You got the job?! Why didn’t you tell me?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, it’s gonna be so great! I’m gonna get to help decide what we sell, I’m gonna have an office with walls and everything. (turns to Monica) I’m gonna have walls!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, is this the day of good news or what? I got us a job! The wedding reception.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ohh! Umm, Phoebe, I kinda need to talk to you about that. (Rachel excuses herself) Umm, well I-I-I think it might be time for me to take a step back from catering.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: But we’ve only had one job.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know, but now we have this second one and it just, it feels like it’s snowballing, y’know?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah! What are you saying?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I got offered the head chef job at Allesandro’s.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s okay, ‘cause y’know what? You don’t really need me for the business.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You’re the cook! With out you it’s just me driving up to people’s houses with empty trays and asking for money!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right. But umm, I-I-I’ll pay you back all the money you invested, and you can keep the van.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: For what? I can’t believe this! I gotta get out of here. (leaves)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe, wait a minute! (runs after her, leaving Rachel alone)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m an assistant buyer!!

content.description: Central Perk, Joey, Ross, and Chandler are making a pit stop on their party tour.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, so we’ll get a little coffee, and get energized, and we’ll head back out.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, all right.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So, we’re having fun, right?

content.speaker: Chandler and Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: We don’t need that wizard guy. We hit a couple of clubs, talked to some strangers, and uh, after this, we’ll head down to the docks and see about that boat thing.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m kinda beat.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Actually, me too.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Are you serious?!

content.speaker: Chandler and Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thank God! I’m exhausted!

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: So you guys want coffees?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, but uh, I don’t want to be up too late, so uh, I’ll have a decaf.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, me too.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Actually, can I get some hot water with a little lemon? I think I strained my voice screaming in there. Does it have to be so loud?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I can’t hear a word you’re saying, my ears are ringing so bad.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m just glad I brought that extra pair of socks, y’know? I used them as mittens, I didn’t want to touch a thing in that last place.
(pause)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: How sad are we?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, I know.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know what? We’re not sad, we’re not sad, we’re just not 21 anymore. Y’know? I’m 29 years old, damnit! And I want to sit in a comfortable chair, and watch television and go to bed at a reasonable hour!

content.speaker: Joey and Ross
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah! And I like to hang out in a quiet place where I can talk to my friends.

content.speaker: Chandler and Ross
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And so what if I like to go home, throw on some Kenny G, and take a bath!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: We’re 29, we’re not women.

content.description: Central Perk, the next day, Phoebe is there.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ohh, here you are. Y’know, I’m-I’m glad you decided to hear me out.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, I’m hearing.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’ve been doing a lot of thinking. A lot! And umm, well, I came up with a whole bunch of businesses you can do with your van. Okay umm, you could be flower delivery person.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Or! A bakery delivery person.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I wa-I wa-I wa…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Pizza?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Monica!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, I’ve got a whole bunch of uh-uh, stuff in this area, but umm, I’m getting the feeling that you don’t want to deliver.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. I’m guessing that if you don’t want to deliver, you probably don’t want to pick stuff up either.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know what, let’s do the catering business.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Really?! Are you sure?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, y’know I-I made a commitment to you. Y’know what, it’d be, it’d be fun.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh! It will be fun! Ohh! Yay! Oh! Okay, ooh, let’s plan the wedding reception. (She grabs the notebook which Monica used for her ideas and starts flipping page after page after page after page after page to find a blank one.) Wow! You really wanted me to do something with this van. (pause) Y’know what, I want you to take the chef job.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah. That’s what you really want. Yeah, I don’t want to be the reason you’re unhappy, that would just make me unhappy, and I really don’t want to be the reason I’m unhappy.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Besides, it might be kinda fun to form the new A-Team.

content.description: Rachel’s office, she is coming in for the day carrying a picture for her new office. Mrs. Lynch is coming out of Joanna’s office, carrying a box.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, hi Mrs. Lynch! Is Joanna in already?

content.speaker: Mrs. Lynch
content.text: Oh my goodness! You haven’t heard!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Heard what?

content.speaker: Mrs. Lynch
content.text: Joanna passed away last night.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God! How?!

content.speaker: Mrs. Lynch
content.text: Well, she was leaving work and she was hit by a cab.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God! Oh, I cannot believe it!

content.speaker: Mrs. Lynch
content.text: I know!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, God. Oh, God. (gets worried) Oh God.

content.speaker: Mrs. Lynch
content.text: I didn’t realize that she was so close.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes, so close. Mrs. Lynch, I know that this is an emotional and difficult time, for all of us. But by any chance did Joanna send any paperwork your way before… it happened.

content.speaker: Mrs. Lynch
content.text: No. Nothing. Imagine, if she had just stepped off that curb a few seconds later.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes-yes, just a few seconds and she’d still be with us—nothing about an assistant buyer?

content.speaker: Mrs. Lynch
content.text: No, I’m sorry. I have to go. (She leaves as Sophie arrives.)

content.speaker: Sophie
content.text: Good morning!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, Sophie, I guess you didn’t hear about Joanna…

content.speaker: Sophie
content.text: I sure did! (smiles)

content.description: Monica’s new kitchen, Allesandro is introducing her to her new employees.

content.speaker: Allesandro
content.text: I’m so excited about having Monica come on board with us. Although I do feel bad about having fired chef Emillio, it’s like losing a member of the family. Of course, that literally is the case for several of you. Tony, Carlos, Marie, please, tell your father how much we’re gonna miss him. Now, I know that Monica has a lot of great ideas for this place, well, you all read the review. So without much further ado, I present to you our new head chef.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Umm, I just wanna say, uh (reads from a 3 X 5 card) that with a pinch of exictement, a dash of hard work, a dollup of cooperation, we can have the recipe… (Looks up and sees eveyone glaring at her) Are you gonna kill me?
